intro: Taraxacum hamosius, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the dandelion family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Its flowers develop into elongated, bristly seed heads that release tiny seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. Taraxacum hamosius is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating skin conditions and digestive issues.
